author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
PDP general secterary Nizam Din Bhat holding a special prayer for the speedy recovery of Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mufti Mohammad Sayeed, in Srinagar on Wednesday.- PHOTO: NISSAR AHMAD

As the budget session of the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly nears, the two partners of the ruling coalition, the People’s Democratic Party (PDP) and the BJP, have expressed their intention to choose PDP president Mehbooba Mufti as the next Chief Minister if any transition of power is required.

State Education Minister and government spokesman Nayeem Akhtar told The Hindu, “Ms. Mufti is a natural choice in case there is any transition of power. There are no deliberations over a caretaker Chief Minister as of now, but Ms.Mufti is the senior leader who played an important role to shape the party. In case of any change of guard, we don’t have to look around much,” said Mr.Akhtar.

Chief Minister Mufti Mohammad Sayeed, also father of Mehbooba Mufti, has been in New Delhi’s AIIMS Hospital since December 24.

He continues to suffer from severe chest infection and requires artificial respiration in the intensive care unit.

However, the coalition partner BJP on Wednesday said it supported the idea of a Chief Minister from the PDP continuing for the entire tenure of six years.

State Minister for Forests, Environment and Ecology, Bali Bhagat said: “The party’s central leadership’s stand to have PDP’s Chief Minister will not change. We are equally worried about the health conditions of the Chief Minister. We all pray he joins back soon.”

“Any stand on who should take over will be taken by the party’s leadership in New Delhi,” he added.
title: Mehbooba will be CM if need arises, says PDP leader
